subject: Re: Pronounciation of .Ah and .Awe
msgSnippet: I notice you double-posted. Unfortunately, to save our members from spamation we have to moderate these forums, and at times it might take a bit before the
messageBody:
I notice you double-posted. Unfortunately, to save our members from spamation we have to moderate these forums, and at times it might take a bit before the message is cleared.
Thank you for your patience.

P.S. I'm not complaining about the double post, just wanted to explain the delay.

--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "hombredepescado" <hombre.de.pescado@...> wrote:
>
> Hi everyone,
>
> I'm new to Quickscript, and there are a couple things I'm not sure I've quite wrapped my head around.
>
> Firstly, I understand that with the British pronunciation of .Ah and .Awe, there would be a considerable difference. However, in the common North American accent, I don't think we pronounce these differentlydo we? If yes, then how so?
>
> Secondly, what didn't seem clear to me from Read's manual was whether you should write according to your own pronunciation, or whether there was some 'master' pronunciation to which you write phonetically.
>
> Thanks,
> Justin
>
